alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Kennebec; Oxford; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 5:41PM EDT until May 22 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest, west central, and western Maine, including the following counties, in south central Maine, Kennebec. In southwest Maine, Androscoggin. In west central Maine, Somerset. In western Maine, Franklin and Oxford. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 539 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in Jay due to heavy rain in the advisory area from thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waterville, Fairfield, Oakland, Rumford, Jay, Belgrade, Livermore Falls, Dixfield, Canton, and Livermore.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
